docs.snippet: LONDON, Jan. 15 (UP) -- The Ministry of Economic Warfare, commenting today on the interception of the French freighter Mendoza outside Montevideo harbor by British warships, said the government of Uruguay had no ground for protest and that the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Jan. 15 (UP) -- The Ministry of Economic Warfare, commenting today on the interception of the French freighter Mendoza outside Montevideo harbor by British warships, said the government of Uruguay had no ground for protest and that the question of violating Uruguayan waters had not arisen.

docs.snippet: Mendoza sails again; believed in Montevideo that sailing orders came from Brit Admiralty after agreement with Vichy; Uruguay insists Brit warship acted within her territorial waters; Brit plane still held; London denies violation of Uruguayan waters
docs.abstract: Mendoza sails again; believed in Montevideo that sailing orders came from Brit Admiralty after agreement with Vichy; Uruguay insists Brit warship acted within her territorial waters; Brit plane still held; London denies violation of Uruguayan waters

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Jan. 18 -- President Roosevelt's recent steps and proposals for helping Great Britain by making the United States "the arsenal of democracy" have been enthusiastically received throughout South America. Public opinion as expressed by...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Jan. 18 -- President Roosevelt's recent steps and proposals for helping Great Britain by making the United States "the arsenal of democracy" have been enthusiastically received throughout South America. Public opinion as expressed by leading newspapers and prominent speakers, official or otherwise, appears unanimous in the belief that if world democracy is to be saved it can be done only under the leadership of the United States and Mr. Roosevelt.

headline.main: OUR STAND BACKED BY SOUTH AMERICA; Roosevelt Proposal to Build an 'Arsenal of Democracy' Is Hailed by the Press COOPERATION PLANS LAID

docs.snippet: ONE of America's "big guns" of international radio -- Station WRUL -- designed to fire projectiles of amity instead of war and conceived twenty-one years ago at the Versailles Peace Conference, is celebrating this month its fifth anniversary as a...
docs.lead_paragraph: ONE of America's "big guns" of international radio -- Station WRUL -- designed to fire projectiles of amity instead of war and conceived twenty-one years ago at the Versailles Peace Conference, is celebrating this month its fifth anniversary as a leading factor in the promotion of understanding and enlightenment among nations.
docs.abstract: station WRUL's broadcasts to Brit discussed

headline.main: FRIENDSHIP 'BRIDGE'; WRUL, Idea Born at Versailles in 1919, Urges World Amity on Powerful Waves

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 18 (AP) -- The British today captured and put a prize crew on board the 8,199-ton French freighter Mendoza, which for the last week had been trying to slip through the British South Atlantic patrols with a cargo of food...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Jan. 18 (AP) -- The British today captured and put a prize crew on board the 8,199-ton French freighter Mendoza, which for the last week had been trying to slip through the British South Atlantic patrols with a cargo of food for France.

headline.main: Freighter Watched for Week; BRITISH OFF BRAZIL SEIZE FRENCH SHIP
